subject: p11413236
History: With SOB, wheezing, please eval for PNA, pulm edema.
Findings: Right pectoral infusion port terminates in upper SVC. Sternotomy wires are intact. Lung volume is low. Mild bibasilar opacities likely reflect atelectasis. Calcification at the AP window likely reflect calcified lymph nodes in a unchanged from before. There is no large pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Mild cardiomegaly is similar to before.
Impression: No convincing radiographic evidence for pneumonia is identified. Mild bibasilar opacities are likely atelectasis.
